body: The mother of a 3-year-old girl found wandering alone in Brooklyn early Christmas morning was charged yesterday with abandoning the girl to attend a Christmas Party. The mother, Anna Almono, 24, was also charged with endangering the welfare of a child, reckless endangerment, second-degree burglary and two counts of petty larceny, according to a
title: Lost Child's Mother Charged

body: The police yesterday interviewed the parents of a 3-year-old girl who was found wandering the streets in Brooklyn early on Christmas and held the girl's mother for questioning. The girl, Monserrate Cadiz, remained in the care of the city department of Special Services for Children. The mother, identified by the police as Anna Almond, was found at a
title: MOTHER QUESTIONED ABOUT GIRL FOUND ON CHRISTMAS

body: Christmas morning, a time of giddy celebration for most children, was colored with sadness for a small girl and the people who found her abandoned on a Brooklyn street corner early yesterday morning. The girl, whom the police believe to be 3 years old, was found about 2:30 A.M. yesterday at the corner of Seventh Avenue and 46th Street in the Sunset
title: LITTLE GIRL IS ABANDONED ON CHRISTMAS MORNING

body: A girl, believed to be 3 years old, at Lutheran Medical Center after she was found abandoned early yesterday on a street in Sunset Park section of Brooklyn. Page B2.
title: Abandoned on Christmas

body: The jazz-blues guitarist Jimmy Ponder will lead a trio tonight at Brown's Cafe, 5601 Second Avenue, in the Sunset Park section of Brooklyn (718-439-5335). There are four sets nightly, beginning at 10; there is a $6 minimum and no cover.
title: Jimmy Ponder

body: The 10th Puerto Rican Discovery Day Parade will be held Sunday in the Sunset Park section of Brooklyn. The procession of floats, marching bands and clowns begins at 1 P.M. at 60th Street and Fifth Avenue and continues down the avenue to 39th Street. The parade is sponsored by local civic organizations and businesses.
title: Puerto Rican Parade

body: ABBREVIATIONS USED IN TABLES Following are the unofficial results in Tuesday's general election. Abbreviations are: D - Democrat, R - Republican, C - Conservative, L - Liberal, RTL - Right to Life. (U) denotes an unopposed candidate. An asterisk (*) denotes an incumbent. The votes of minor party candidates will not be available until official
title: THE ELECTIONS: FACTS AND FIGURES; Tallies for U.S. Senator and Statewide Offices

body: LIKE a stretching dragon awakening from a long slumber, Chinatown is bursting its traditional Chatham Square boundaries, spreading north in Manhattan and sprawling over the metropolitan area to spawn satellite neighborhoods in Queens, Brooklyn, Staten Island and New Jersey. Indeed, it is not only Chinese who are expanding beyond what was in 1960 an
title: Satellite Chinatowns Burgeon Throughout New York

body: ''IT'S a roller-coaster experience - I wouldn't mind the ups and downs so much if there was a stretch between the peaks and valleys,'' said Ralph Strafaci, an airline executive. ''But if you have a good partner, it helps a lot.'' ''Stressful isn't the word for it, it's overwhelming,'' said Tina Strafaci, Ralph's wife and partner in the
title: Making a Town-House Dream a Reality

body: To some residents of the East New York section of Brooklyn, it was only a matter of time before the illegal drag races on Vandalia Avenue resulted in tragedy. The strip, at Fountain Avenue in the Spring Creek area, in a sparsely populated industrial area near the Starrett City housing development, has long been used for racing, its curbs and
title: TWO KILLED IN A BROOKLYN DRAG RACE

body: Peter Orlando of Brooklyn likes to watch television by himself. But these days he has lots of company. ''Mostly they come to watch sports and the Mets games,'' he said last night as he prepared for another onslaught of neighbors and friends to ''just drop by.'' ''I'm finding that a lot more beer is being consumed,'' he said, ''and that I have to
title: AT LONG LAST, CABLE COMES TO BROOKLYN

body: For more than 60 years a cluster of industrial buildings on the Brooklyn waterfront once known as Bush Terminal has provided millions of square feet of space for the city's manufacturers. Now the new owners of the sprawling complex on Gowanus Bay will offer manufacturers the opportunity to purchase their space through a condominium arrangement.
title: ABOUT REAL ESTATE; INDUSTRIAL CONDOMINIUMS AT THE OLD BUSH TERMINAL

body: The bodies of a man in his 60's and a woman in her 20's were found yesterday in a ransacked Brooklyn apartment, and the police said they both appeared to be victims of homicide. Officers in the 72d Precinct found the bodies at 8:45 A.M. in the bedroom of a ground-floor apartment at 263 61st Street in the Sunset Park section. The police said they
title: THE CITY; 2 Bodies Found In an Apartment

body: A Brooklyn man who pleaded guilty to killing an elderly woman last year in a hit-and-run accident while driving without a license was sentenced yesterday to 300 hours of community service. The defendant, Rafael Corona, of 733 53d Street in the Sunset Park section, could have received up to four years in prison for criminally negiligent homicide.
title: Hit-Run Killer Is Told To Serve Community

body: In a five-year period in the late 1960's and early 70's, the Bushwick neighborhood of Brooklyn was transformed from a neatly maintained community of wood houses into what often approached a no man's land of abandoned buildings, empty lots, drugs and arson. Its largely Italian and German working-class residents fled in droves, and under the most
title: F.H.A. CASE RECALLS BUSHWICK IN 70'S
